abstract.p: Shares of Motorola rise $1.8125, to $36.8125 on August 2 after report that company expects to meet analysts' profit and revenue forecasts for 2000 and 2001 (S)

block.p: Shares of Motorola rose $1.8125, to $36.8125 yesterday, after officials said the company expected to meet analysts' profit and revenue forecasts for this year and next. Speaking late Tuesday at the company's annual meeting with Wall Street analysts in Chicago, Motorola's president, Robert Growney, said estimates of $47 billion in sales and earnings of $1.43 a share next year were ''achievable'' and that the company was sticking with its forecast for profit of $1.05 a share on 39.5 billion in sales for 2000.
